examples.translation: まだら模様のアナグマ

etymology.value: Origin uncertain. Possibly from Old French bauson, meaning badger.

usage_notes.explanation: This is an obsolete word, meaning it is no longer in general use. It was used to describe animals or objects with white stripes or a mottled appearance.

readability_explanation.text: This word is highly archaic and unlikely to be encountered in modern English except in historical texts or specialized contexts.
